This guide is a simplified overview of '''all non-experimental changes''' in [[Mounts of Mayhem]] ({{JE}} 1.21.11), which assumes at least some familiarity with [[The Copper Age]] (''Java Edition'' 1.21.9 and 1.21.10), excluding experimental features in this version.

== Mobs ==
=== New ===
{|{{Simple Guide table|New Mobs}}
|-
|[[Camel Husk]]
|[[File:Camel Husk Walk JE1.gif|128px]]
|
*[[Desert]] (as part of [[Camel Husk#Spawning|Camel Husk Jockeys]]).
|
* {{Drop|Item|Rotten Flesh|2|3}}
* {{xp|1|3}} (when killed by a [[player]] or tamed [[wolf]])
|
*Is passive without a rider.
* Supports two riders.
* Can be tamed with rabbit's feet.
*Counts as a hostile [[monster]].
|-
|[[Nautilus]]
|{{Animate|Nautilus.gif; Baby Nautilus.gif|150px}}
|
*[[Ocean biomes|Ocean]].
|
* {{Drop|Item|Nautilus Shell|0|1}}
* {{xp|1|3}} (when killed by a [[player]] or tamed [[wolf]])
|
*Is neutral.
*Can be tamed using [[pufferfish (item)|pufferfish]] and bred using fish. Once tamed and saddled, it can be [[ridden]] and grants the player the [[Breath of the Nautilus]] effect.
|-
| [[Parched]]
| [[File:Parched.png|128px]]
|
* [[Desert]]
* Part of [[camel husk jockey]]s.
|
* {{Drop|Item|Bone|0|2}}
* {{Drop|Item|Arrow|0|2}}
* {{Drop|Item|Arrow of Weakness|0|1}}
* {{xp|5}}, plus {{xp|1|3}} per natural equipment not drop (when killed by a [[player]] or tamed [[wolf]])
| Shoots arrows of weakness.
|-
|[[Zombie Nautilus]]
|{{Animate|Zombie Nautilus.gif; Coral Zombie Nautilus.gif|150px}}
|
*[[Ocean (disambiguation)|Ocean]] (as part of [[zombie nautilus jockey]]s).
|
* {{Drop|Item|Rotten Flesh|0|3}}
* {{xp|1|3}} (when killed by a [[player]] or tamed [[wolf]])
|
*Is neutral without a rider.
*Can be tamed using [[pufferfish (item)|pufferfish]]. Once tamed and saddled, it can be ridden and grants the player the [[Breath of the Nautilus]] effect.
*Has a different texture when it spawns in [[warm ocean]]s.
*Counts as a hostile [[monster]].
|-

|}

=== Changed ===
{|{{Simple Guide table|Changed Mobs}}
|-
|[[Horse]], [[donkey]], [[mule]], [[camel]], [[llama]], [[trader llama]]
|{{animate|White Horse.png;Donkey.png;Mule.png;Camel.png;Brown Llama.png;Brown Trader Llama.png|150px}}
|
No longer sinks in water while being ridden.
|-
|[[Husk]]
|[[File:Husk.png|150px]]
|
*Can now hold spears.
*Can now spawn as a camel husk jockey.
*Now has a chance to drop a rabbit's foot if killed while riding a camel husk.
|-
|[[Piglin]]
|[[File:Piglin.png|150px]]
|
*Can now hold golden spears.
|-
|[[Zombie]]
|[[File:Zombie.png|150px]]
|
*Can now hold spears.
*Can now spawn as a zombie horseman.
*Now has a chance to drop a red mushroom if killed while riding a zombie horse.
|-
|[[Zombified piglin]]
|[[File:Zombified Piglin.png|150px]]
|
*Can now hold golden spears.
|-
|[[Zombie horse]]
|[[File:Zombie Horse_JE6.png|150px]]
|
* Now spawns naturally.
* Now counts as a hostile [[monster]].
*Has an updated texture.
* Now has 25 health points (12.5 hearts) of health.
* Spawns in darkness, and burns in sunlight like other undead mobs.
* Drops 2-3 [[rotten flesh]].
* Can be healed and tempted using red mushrooms.
* Can be tamed in the same fashion as regular [[horses]], and can then be mounted and controlled by a player.
** Tamed zombie horses are persistent and do not despawn.
** Can be equipped with a [[saddle]] and [[horse armor]].
*** Horse armor protects zombie horses from sunlight damage.
* Has variable movement speed and jump strength, determined when they spawn.
*No longer sinks in water while being ridden.
|}
